ygData.subject: RE: Thank you Brian!  Verant does listen!
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree that most SKs will be kinda disappointed when they actually get these spells. But realistically, what else from the Necro spell book were they going to
ygData.messageBody:
I agree that most SKs will be kinda disappointed when
they actually get these spells.
But realistically, what else from the Necro spell book
were they going to give us?
They already dumbed down our attack spells at higher
levels, so believing that they would give us more
wouldnt make sense.
And other than an upgrade to Sheildskin, Necros dont
have much for buffing either.

Like the rest of our spells they are going to be weak
for the level in which we get them.
Use them as you see fit, or dont usee them at all. For
most of us, the latter would put us right back in the
same spot we are in now. So no harm-no foul.

I was really down on SheidSkin when they changed that.
And though i would rather have Banshee back,
SheildSkin isnt nearly as pathetic as i thought it
would be.
I use it to pull casters or things with their own HT.
And the SheildSkin usually eats a good part of the
initial casting.

So i dont think this will be as wonderful as some are
hoping, but i dont think it will be as bad as some
think it will be either.

Bathory D'Allatu

--- "Wilson, ThomasX B" <thomasx.b.wilson@...>
wrote:
> While I applaud the removal of the useless spells
> listed, I see the spells
> them giving us to be equally useless. These spells
> will only benefit the
> lower level Sk's, and even then only in very limited
> situations (SOLO). In
> my opinion this is another example of listening to
> the majority sheep out
> there that get it in their head what would be good
> for the class without
> playing that class to a decent level (30+). I
> believe that SK's would have
> been better served by giving us better offensive
> spells, or even some
> defensive buffs.
>
> These lifetaps are barely adequate for Necros at the
> levels they get them,
> for SK's they would be a gimmick (and again now they
> can claim that SK's
> have healing). I would have much rather seen the
> skill cap on Bind wound
> bumped from 100 to 200.
>
>
> Oh well just my opinion.
>
> Thom
> Occasionally Columnist at the always tasty Voodoo
> Extreme...
> http:\\www.voodooextreme.com
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chip Paul [mailto:cpaul@...]

> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Subject: [shadowknight] Thank you Brian! Verant does
> listen!
>
>
> From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>
>
> Straight from the test server login...
> Thank you Brian for listening to the players.
> Although some may be
> dismayed at the loss of Voice Graft, all in all I
> don't think anyone
> can complain about this one. Let's hope this makes
> it to the live
> servers.
>
> Xilith
>
> October 21st, 10:30am
> ---------------------
>
> *ShadowKnight Enhancements*
>
> Shadowknights may now use the following spells:
>
> - LifeTap may now be cast at level 9.
> - LifeSpike may now be cast at level 15.
> - LifeDraw may now be cast at level 30.
>
> The LifeTap, LifeSpike, and LifeDraw spell scrolls
> may be purchased from
> any ShadowKnight spell vendor.
>
> To make room for these new spells, the following
> spells are no longer
> available for ShadowKnights:
>
> - Reclaim Energy
> - Mend Bones
> - Voice Graft
>
> - The EverQuest Team
